185930181.review:
iRacing has firmly established itself as a premier racing simulator, offering an unparalleled experience for motorsport enthusiasts and professional drivers alike. Since its launch in 2008, it has continually evolved, setting the benchmark for realism and competitive online racing.

Unmatched Realism and Physics

At the core of iRacing's appeal is its commitment to authenticity. The simulator employs advanced physics models to replicate the nuances of real-world racing, providing users with a highly realistic driving experience. This dedication to detail has made iRacing a preferred platform for professional drivers seeking virtual practice environments. 

Comprehensive Content and Continuous Updates

iRacing boasts an extensive selection of cars and tracks, meticulously laser-scanned to ensure precise replication of their real-world counterparts. The platform regularly introduces new content and features, such as the recent addition of realistic rain physics, enhancing the depth and immersion of the racing experience. 

Robust Online Community and Competitive Environment

The platform's structured licensing system ensures that drivers compete against others of similar skill levels, fostering fair and competitive racing. This system, combined with a strong emphasis on clean driving, has cultivated a community of dedicated sim racers who value both competition and camaraderie. 

Professional Endorsements and eSports Integration

iRacing's authenticity has attracted professional drivers and racing teams, integrating the simulator into training regimens and eSports competitions. The platform hosts official virtual racing series, such as the eNASCAR Coca-Cola iRacing Series, further bridging the gap between virtual and real-world racing. 

Conclusion

For those seeking a highly realistic and immersive racing simulator, iRacing stands out as a top choice. Its unwavering commitment to authenticity, continuous content updates, and vibrant online community make it a worthwhile investment for serious sim racers.

185522087.review:
iRacing est sans aucun doute l'une des meilleures simulations de course automobile que j'ai eu l'occasion de découvrir. Ce qui me séduit avant tout dans ce jeu, c'est son réalisme absolument bluffant. Les circuits sont reproduits à la perfection grâce à la technologie de numérisation laser, capturant chaque aspérité de la piste, chaque vibreur, et même l'environnement alentour. Ajoutez à cela une physique de conduite d'une précision chirurgicale : les sensations de freinage, d'accélération, et la gestion des virages varient en fonction des conditions de course, du type de véhicule et même des réglages que l'on choisit. On se croirait vraiment dans le cockpit d'une voiture de course.

Au-delà de cet aspect technique impressionnant, c'est la compétitivité du jeu qui le rend encore plus addictif. iRacing est bien plus qu'un simple jeu : c'est une véritable plateforme pour les passionnés de sports mécaniques. Son système de classement (le fameux iRating) est conçu pour mettre en compétition des joueurs de niveau similaire, ce qui garantit des courses équilibrées et intenses. Cela crée une dynamique où chaque position compte et où l'amélioration de ses compétences devient une véritable motivation. De plus, les compétitions organisées sont variées et souvent d'un niveau professionnel, attirant même des pilotes réels.

Ce que j'apprécie particulièrement, c'est que la communauté iRacing est très engagée et sérieuse. Contrairement à d'autres jeux de course, où les comportements parfois irresponsables peuvent gâcher l'expérience, ici, on trouve une véritable discipline. Les courses sont bien encadrées, avec des règles strictes et une modération efficace. Cela renforce l'immersion et le respect entre les pilotes.

Certes, le modèle économique basé sur un abonnement et l'achat de contenu supplémentaire peut sembler dissuasif au premier abord. Mais pour moi, le niveau de détail, les mises à jour régulières et l'accès à une expérience compétitive unique justifient largement cet investissement. C'est un jeu conçu pour les passionnés, et il récompense largement ceux qui s'y plongent pleinement.

En résumé, iRacing est une expérience unique qui allie réalisme, immersion et compétitivité à un niveau rarement atteint. Si vous êtes un amateur de sports mécaniques, à la recherche de défis authentiques et d'une communauté engagée, alors ce jeu est fait pour vous.

185346004.review:
Most people consider iRacing THE sim-racing title, warts and all. There isn't anything like iRacing within the sim-racing sphere. At almot any time of the day, you'll find a race somewhere being ran. Drivers celebrating every victory like it is their last. Others relishing in the agony of defeat. 

It's what made me finally take the jump. After 10+ years of sim-racing, it was more or less what I expected (which is a bit disappointing).

It's practically an MMO given the purchasing model and rather open-ended content structure. If there's a series you want to run, you'll be paying hand over fist for every track and car. If you want truly everything, it'll be thousands of dollars in addition to your standard subscription fee every month by the way..

If you're anything like me, you'll finally dip a toe in. Pick a few series you want to run based off of your real-life motorsport tastes..but grow annoyed with the uninutitive physics model.
While improved from previous iterations, it still has several massive issues. To keep it somewhat brief
- Tyres insanely sensitive to oversteer, tyre slip 
- Cars having too much aero relative to IRL counterparts
- ABS & hybrid engine systems functioning unlike they do in real life
Not to mention even larger issues that plague niche licenses like dirt road & dirt oval. (Don't even get me started on the plague that is the idea of a setup shop having a bloody subscription service when you are already paying a subscription for the service in the first place. How about a subscription for better overlays than the dated ones in-game too! Might as well make a five-layer lasagna out of all these money-milking services!)

Don't get me wrong, the matchmaking system iRacing uses to populate their service is nearly 1/1 but it has its own flaws.

You start your journey with a rookie safety license which grants you access to beginner-friendly cars to help you figure out the basics of race procedure and racecraft. 

 Even as you get into higher safety rating classes and higher splits, the racing standards don't improve. Of course this varies from license to license but generally is pretty hit or miss. If anything, they get worse as drivers get faster & faster; and more daring and reckless with their offensive driving manuvers. For example, when a B-class sportscar race with a average iRating (iRacing's ELO system) of 2.2k is filled with more dangerous drivers than a comparable lobby in C-class with a average rating of 1.5k, then surely there is something wrong right? I can't imagine putting in the effort to get a fairly high iRating in your favorite class only for the racing standards to improve marginally or even get worse in some cases.

 I've seen people chalk most of this up to the growth of sim racing since the pandemic (the more apples you pick, the more rotten you'll find) but I think it's two-fold. iRacing's flawed, no-fault safety rating system contributes to this too. Using the same hand to punish someone avoiding an incident or getting caught up in another racer's reckless mess as you do if they are wrecking people just didn't make sense to me. It's a complicated issue that I don't really know if it has any answer. Maybe it's me getting burnt out and disappointed with the overall experience with the service but the general lack of a racing standard, particuarly across the road racing licenses is what shocked me. 

Not to mention the hivemind of a community who will sycophantically praise iRacing for its feature list (which is already being replicated for a much cheaper cost for other devs or community members of other titles) while deflecting any and all  critique back at frustrated users.


(I'm no world-beater, for what it's worth. My iR across sportscar sits around 1.8k and 1.7k in open-wheelers. Oval, dirt oval and dirt road are there or even higher. I know I've raced way too much and won often enough in the six months I've been on iRacing to know that I don't completely suck.)

Nevertheless, if you have the patience, time and most importantly, money to pay the costs to truly get everything you'd want out of iRacing (it being your main hobby of choice), then I'd say go for it.

If you're a average or above average sim racer who wants to actually enjoy the hobby and not waste a bunch of money, then stick with titles like Automoblista 2 and Assetto Corsa. Not to forget older titles like rFactor 2, GTR2, NR2003, or even older titles like the fantastic Grand Prix Series or the underrated IndyCar Racing II.

There's plenty of ways to enjoy this hobby in a fun & healthy way; I think for most people, iRacing doesn't factor into that. It's too costly given the amount of glaring issues it has and I simply cannot recommend it for that reason at this time.

185199254.review:
Tried it for 3,74 euro, played it for around 2 weeks and got above 2000 iRating in the first 5 days. Without paying $13 for each car and $16 for each track, there is not much to do. On the formula side, you cant race anything faster than the Formula 1600. Once I got above 2000 iRating, I was usually placed in the top split, which meant playing againts people anywhere between 2000 and 7000 iRating, which is not much fun as a rookie.
The positives: 
-the driving
-the matchmaking progression system

The negatives:
-paid cars and tracks on top of a subscription system is outrageous (it would be acceptable if it was only the cars in my opinion, but there are so many tracks you would have to buy)
-the matchmaking placing players from literally any continent into american servers would cause some players to blip in and out of existence every few seconds
-the crash physics seemed a bit exeggerated and sometimes they were completely broken (cars stuck inside each other after a crash for example)
-the graphics look really outdated, but the framerate is similar to ACC on High settings, which looks much better

Overall, the high prices are the main factor. You can buy the Ultimate bundle of Asetto Corsa Competizione for 60 euros on sale and keep it forever, while all your paid content (which can easily go above 500) on iRacing is useless if you are not actively subscribed.

185137091.review:
The physics in this game for tires are horrid, one of the worst I've encountered in any "sim racing" game. Cold tires on the first lap behave poorly, it's hard to push them to their limits because the game is so punishing. Coming from AssetoCorsa it's just night and day a bad experience because you cannot recover and you feel helpless when you are pushing the car. Once you lose tire grip there's no saving the vehicle and you slide like you're on an ice rink. 

Monthly sub + having to buy each individual vehicle reminds me of the F2P game model, but the subscription alone would cover car packs in other games, with multiple vehicles. The price is too high for such a sub part experience. 2008 engine that looks like it's never been updated. I wouldn't mind the graphics if the physics were good, but both fall short. Not to mention the performance is even worse. 80 fps average!?!? I'm sitting at 144 on AC all day with good visuals.

The worst part I've found is, drivers are hyper competitive and you lose points because they dive bomb into corners and hit you for pole positions, spinning you out and giving you negative safety rating and ruining your iRating and improving theirs. Terrible experience overall, I'm just glad I didn't sink $100's of dollars for cars that aren't utilized anymore or continue paying a monthly subscription for a game that is brings more stress than fun. Not worth it in the slightest. I had a 10 year gap between 2 months of usage, and I can safely say I will not be back anytime soon.

184099256.review:
[h1] IRACING NÃO GARANTE A PROMOÇÃO PARA PESSOAS QUE JÁ ASSINARAM ANTERIORMENTE. [/h1]

Mas é lei.

(Projeto de lei nº 258, de 2014, do Deputado Alencar Santana Braga - PT)

O PRESIDENTE DA ASSEMBLEIA LEGISLATIVA:

Faço saber que a Assembleia Legislativa decreta e eu promulgo, nos termos do artigo 28, § 8º, da Constituição do Estado, a seguinte lei:

Artigo 1º - Ficam os fornecedores de serviços prestados de forma contínua obrigados a conceder a seus clientes preexistentes os mesmos benefícios de promoções posteriormente realizadas.

Parágrafo único - Para os efeitos desta lei, enquadram-se na classificação de prestadores de serviços contínuos, dentre outros:

1. concessionárias de serviço telefônico, energia elétrica, água, gás e outros serviços essenciais;

2. operadoras de TV por assinatura;

3. provedores de “internet”;

4. operadoras de planos de saúde;

5. serviço privado de educação;

6. [u] outros serviços prestados de forma contínua aos consumidores. [/u]

Artigo 2º - A extensão do benefício de promoções realizadas pelas empresas prestadoras de serviço a seus antigos clientes será automática, a partir do lançamento da promoção, sem distinção fundada na data de adesão ou qualquer outra forma de discriminação dentro da área geográfica da oferta.

Artigo 3º - O fornecedor de serviço que não cumprir o disposto nesta lei ficará sujeito às seguintes sanções:

I - multa de 10 (dez) a 1.000 (mil) Unidades Fiscais do Estado de São Paulo (UFESPs), para cada cliente anterior à promoção não beneficiado pela promoção lançada;

II - multa em dobro e cassação da inscrição estadual, em caso de reincidência.

Artigo 4º - A fiscalização desta lei ficará a cargo da Fundação de Proteção e Defesa do Consumidor - PROCON, que poderá firmar convênios com os Municípios para o mesmo fim.

Artigo 5º - Esta lei entra em vigor após decorridos 60 (sessenta) dias de sua publicação oficial.

Assembleia Legislativa do Estado de São Paulo, aos 2 de julho de 2015.

a) Fernando Capez - Presidente Publicada na Secretaria da Assembleia Legislativa do Estado de São Paulo, aos 2 de julho de 2015.

O problema é que eles só pagam a multa por pessoa que acionar o Procon.

Quer ter a chance de assinar o plano anual com desconto toda vez e assim ser possível de jogar com um preço justo? Dá uma passada no procon. :)

(antes que venham puxar o saco da steam ou iracing dizendo que eles não precisam seguir as regras daqui e tal, lembrem-se do caso recente do X/twitter) ;)
